review: I learned something today.  I have a cable subscription that includes HBO and Showtime.  I assumed that if my cable company had a deal in place with the channel I would be able to watch the channel on all of my devices.  I can watch HBOGo on my Smart TV,  windows computer, my Android tablet, my Android phone, my old Roku 1 (I bought the fire TV to replace this), Xbox 360, XBOX One, my son's Playstation 3 and 4, and my wife's iPad.HOWEVER,  my cable company (Charter) doesn't support HBOGO on Amazon Fire TV.  I debated back and forth between a new Roku 3 and Fire TV and decided Fire TV was a better fit for me.  I was really disappointed about the premium channels.  I gave the device 4 stars because it is super fast and very responsive.  I also liked the separate game controller and game selection. I sent it back and got the Roku 3 so I could access my premium channels (The Roku 3 works great BTW).My suggestion to you is to go to the "activation" websites (ie: hbogo.com/activate) for the "cable" apps you want to run to be sure your cable company supports them.  Don't  assume because they work on one device that they will work on another.Also, I give Amazon's return policy 5 stars.  Easiest return ever.
author: Amazon Customer
